title: How To Eat Healthy When Eating Out
summary: When possible, choose dishes that are packed with fiber and protein. Whole grains are a great source of fiber, B vitamins, iron, and other nutrients. Check the ingredients list for the items that go into your meal. Be wary of French fries, fried veggies and other fried sides. Be careful of burgers that come with 80% meat or less, and be careful with your bun and condiment choices. Avoid heavy white breads and load up on veggies and lean proteins instead of heavy breads.

So, when possible, choose dishes that are packed with fiber and protein, like these options:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Soups - Unless your soup is loaded with cheese and croutons, it will typically be very low in calories and fat."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Salads - Salads are full of fiber and protein. You can also add beans to salads for even more protein."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Stuffed veggies - Choose dishes that are stuffed with veggies, like bell peppers and mushrooms, over ones that come with heavy sauces or too much cheese."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Pasta - Choose whole-wheat pasta to up the fiber content.")),mdx("h2",null,"Look for whole grains"),mdx("p",null,"Whole grains are a great source of fiber, B vitamins, iron, and other nutrients. The difference between whole grains and refined grains, like white flour, is that whole grains retain their bran and germ. This means they have a higher fiber and protein content."),mdx("p",null,"When choosing your grains, consider these options:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Brown rice - Brown rice has more fiber than white rice."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Barley - Barley is a great source of fiber, B vitamins, and iron."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Whole-wheat pasta - Choose whole-wheat pasta over regular pasta for more fiber and nutrients.")),mdx("h2",null,"Watch out for sauces"),mdx("p",null,"Many sauces are full of fat and calories. Some examples:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Pesto - Pesto is typically made with olive oil, so it\u2019s an unprocessed fat with minimal calories and fat."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Salsa - Choose salsa over creamy sauces like alfredo or ranch."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Marinara - Marinara sauce is typically made with tomatoes and onions, so it\u2019s a very healthy option.")),mdx("h2",null,"Check the ingredients list"),mdx("p",null,"When you can, check the ingredients list for the items that go into your meal. This will help you spot potential allergens and unhealthy ingredients that you might otherwise miss. You can also use this information to make healthier choices. For example:"),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"If a meal comes with rice, beans, and veggies, you can ask if they can replace the rice with additional veggies."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"If a meal comes with white pasta, you can ask if they can use whole-wheat pasta instead."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"If a meal comes with heavy sauces or cheese, ask if they can leave it out or substitute it for something healthier.")),mdx("h2",null,"Order veggies"),mdx("p",null,"Many restaurants will let you add as many veggies as you want to your meal. You can ask to add veggies to anything\u2014salads, soups, pastas, stir-frys, sandwiches, and more. And if a restaurant is too fancy for this, you can always DIY by ordering a side of veggies to go with your meal."),mdx("p",null,"In general, though, be careful with your vegetable choices. Some vegetables are higher in calories and fat than others. And many restaurants will fry or fry-fry their veggies in unhealthy oils. Be wary of French fries, fried veggies, and other fried sides."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t be afraid of the dark side"),mdx("p",null,"Burgers, sandwiches, and other classic casual fare can be healthy options when eaten in moderation. Look for burgers that are made with 80% meat or less, and be careful with your bun and condiment choices. When possible, choose burgers that come with lettuce and tomato over buns, and skip the mayo or heavy sauces for a healthier option."),mdx("p",null,"Sandwiches can also be a healthy choice, as long as you choose wisely. Avoid heavy white breads and load up on veggies and lean proteins instead. Wraps can be great options if you\u2019re unsure about the contents of your sandwich."),mdx("h2",null,"Final words"),mdx("p",null,"Eating out can be enjoyable and healthy, but it can also be challenging. The best way to overcome these challenges is to be prepared and knowledgeable. By following these tips, you will be able to make better decisions when eating out and keep your diet in check. With some practice and patience, you can eat healthy when eating out."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Way to Start Your Day - With a Healthy Morning Routine

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In a world that moves as fast as ours, it can be easy to get caught up in the daily hustle and forget about the little things. But those little things are what make all the difference in the end. Take morning routines, for example. They may not seem like much on their own, but they have the power to make or break your day from start to finish.
With so many different morning routines out there, it can be difficult to know which one is right for you. There are those that are super long and involved, and others that are much shorter and simpler. Whether you\u2019re looking for something simple or something a little more intense, we\u2019ve got you covered with this ultimate guide on how to start your day with a healthy routine.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 7 Tips for Getting Motivated to Exercise
How to Make Time for Self-Care When You're Busy
The Benefits of Exercise and How to Get Started
3 Easy Exercises You Can Do in Your Home That Will Make You Lose Weight

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you get home from work, the last thing you want to do is another workout. But working out is essential for losing weight and keeping it off. Exercise not only helps you lose weight faster and keep it off, but also improves your overall health and reduces the risk of developing chronic diseases. If you feel like hitting the gym after work isn\u2019t an option, take a look at these easy ways you can get moving in the comfort of your own home.
Working out at home has many benefits; it\u2019s convenient, cheap, private, and most importantly\u2014you can do it whenever you want! It\u2019s also a great way to strengthen your body without needing to leave the house or spend a lot of money on expensive gym memberships or personal trainers. Working out in your home not only saves you time but is also a convenient way to keep yourself motivated to stay active every day.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Your Home a Haven

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Regular Exercise - And How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Getting into a regular workout routine is something that\u2019s a lot easier said than done for most people. While some of us have it easier than others when it comes to fitting fitness into our busy lives, we all struggle with different things at one point or another. It\u2019s easy to let other responsibilities fall by the wayside and not get moving, so you need to be strategic about how and when you work out. While there are many different benefits to exercise, the biggest thing that it has to offer is stress reduction. If you\u2019re looking for ways to reduce your stress in your everyday life, adding exercise to your routine is a great place to start. Here are some reasons why getting your sweat on regularly could be exactly what you need right now:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Snacks More Exciting
The Best Healthy Snacks to Keep You Going

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Think about your typical work day. You probably spend the first few hours of it at your desk, sipping on a cup of coffee, reading emails, and maybe even taking a brief walk around the office to stretch your legs. Then you head back to your desk, only to dive into an afternoon filled with more reading and typing\u2014no time for walking again. And by 5pm you\u2019re ready to call it a day and head home. However, in that short span of time, you need to find some way to keep going through all those tasks. What do you do?
The answer is simple: Healthy snacks! Think about how much time you spend away from home throughout the day \u2013 whether it\u2019s at work or school, there are plenty of opportunities for snacking. In fact, keeping healthy snacks around can help boost your energy when you need it most. Check out these top-rated healthy snacks that will keep you going all day long\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Exercising Your Way to a Fitter You: Walk or Run - Which Is Best for You?

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"In today\u2019s fast-paced world, we have less time to work out and still keep up with all our responsibilities. But with the right plan, anyone can make time for exercise. The question is: What type of exercise should you focus on to get the best results in the shortest amount of time? Walking or running may seem like two very different exercises, but when it comes to burning fat and calories, your body responds in similar ways no matter which one you choose. In this article, we\u2019ll discuss the benefits of each one and which is best for you based on your personal fitness level. Keep reading to discover more!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
